blasphemy.question: Did you swear God's name without reverence?
blasphemy.description: This sin violates the Second Commandment by treating God's holy name with disrespect rather than reverence.

blasphemy.question: Have I received Holy Communion while knowingly in a state of grave sin, thereby profaning the real presence of Christ?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: while knowingly in a state of sin that manifested through ingratitude for blessings
within my family life and relationships
lukewarmness.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while knowingly in a state of sin that manifested through ingratitude for blessings, disrespect towards God's presence, or spiritual indifference within my family life and relationships?
lukewarmness.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

greed.question: Did I make the accumulation of money and possessions a driving force in my life, leading me to idolize wealth over God's providence?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

greed.question: Did I make accumulating wealth a driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

oppression.question: Did I mistreat, harass, or discriminate against others through my actions?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: through my actions and decisions that deny them their dignity and well - being
oppression.question: Did I mistreat, harass, or discriminate against others through my actions and decisions that deny them their dignity and well-being?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

oppression.question: Did I engage in any actions, whether through words or deeds, that unjustly oppressed or discriminated against others?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: rather than seeing them in their full humanity
lust.question: Did I reduce others to their usefulness, rather than seeing them in their full humanity?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

rather than seeing them as whole people made in God 's image
lust.question: Did I reduce others to their appearance, usefulness, or what they could do for me, rather than seeing them as whole people made in God's image?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

as individuals created in God 's image
lust.question: Have I reduced others to their usefulness, rather than seeing them as individuals created in God's image?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence, leading me to believe that my accomplishments were solely due to my own self-sufficiency?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I secretly harbored discontent for others' blessings, wishing they would lose them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: to family members , friends , or acquaintances with vulgar or inappropriate language
incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and speak to family members, friends, or acquaintances with vulgar or inappropriate language?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to my loved ones with vulgar or inappropriate language, showing a lack of self-restraint and violating their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control when speaking to others, using language that was unbecoming of my dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, demonstrating an excessive attachment to pleasure that neglects my call to temperance?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially when it involves habits related to household well-being?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in sharing others ' private affairs through words
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs through words, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.
